snippet: Egyptian prosecutors said Monday that Abdullah Morsi, the youngest son of former President Mohamed Morsi would be tried on charges of drug use and possession, an accusation his family dismisses as an attempt to tarnish their image.
abstract: Egyptian prosecutors say Abdullah Morsi, youngest son of former Pres Mohamed Morsi, will be tried on charges of drug use and possession, accusation his family dismisses as an attempt to tarnish their image.
lead_paragraph: Egyptian prosecutors said Monday that Abdullah Morsi, the youngest son of former President Mohamed Morsi would be tried on charges of drug use and possession, an accusation his family dismisses as an attempt to tarnish their image.

headline.main: Morsi’s Son Faces Drug Charges in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Egypt: Morsi’s Son Faces Drug Charges
